title: The pioneering Scots photographer who captured China
description: John Thomson spent a decade during the 19th century capturing images from all walks of life in the Far East.

title: What climate scientists can teach us about dealing with climate change doom
description: Climate anxiety is on the rise, so we spoke to climate scientists about what helps them deal with feelings of hopelessness.

title: Rape claim sparks fury over China's work drinking
description: As public scrutiny of corporate misbehaviour grows, can business drinking be dropped forever?

title: Budget Ukrainian airline swaps high heels for trainers
description: Flight attendants with Ukraine's SkyUp say the new uniform is much better for their health.

title: Bringing a centuries-old craft back to life in County Tyrone
description: Glass-cutting in County Tyrone was once world-renowned, and the craft in the area dates back to 1771.

title: The American father and son building a Gothic folly in France
description: Donald Russell, 94, and his son Sam are building a Gothic-inspired edifice in the French countryside.

title: Elephant Man dissection: 'Joseph Merrick would be heartbroken'
description: Disability campaigners including Adam Pearson oppose an Elephant Man dissection show.

title: 'Girls are very much involved in exploitation in gangs'
description: An ex-gang member turned exploitation consultant explains the role of females within a gang structure.

title: Motorway protests: Patel to promise new powers over blockages
description: The home secretary will promise tougher sentences, after a series of recent climate demonstrations.

title: 'Speedo Mick' asked to leave Cornwall pub for being underdressed
description: Mick Cullen, who walks in swimming trunks, is told he cannot stay "dressed like this."

title: Paris attacks: Haunting survivors' memories shake terror trial
description: The harrowing, personal, stories of people caught up in the 2015 attacks take centre stage in Paris.

title: Analysis: Met facing questions over Everard murder
description: There is an air of crisis in British policing this weekend as it faces a great moment of reckoning.

title: Windermere climber completes 83 ascents in two months
description: Anna Taylor, from Cumbria, climbed routes listed in Ken Wilson's renowned guidebook Classic Rock.

title: Queen officially opens the Scottish Parliament at Holyrood
description: Her Majesty spoke of the challenge of Covid and her "deep and abiding affection" for Scotland in an address to MSPs.

title: Cleveland police chief Steve Turner referred to watchdog
description: The Independent Office for Police Conduct is considering whether to take action over Steve Turner.

title: Petrol deliveries: Visas for foreign lorry drivers extended
description: The government is issuing 300 visas to overseas fuel tanker drivers "immediately" to ease delivery issues.

title: Covid: Care home staff should get the jab or another job - Javid
description: The health secretary says he will not delay the November deadline for workers to be fully vaccinated.

title: Saracens agree £32m takeover by consortium including World Cup-winning captain Pienaar
description: Saracens have agreed a £32m takeover deal with a consortium of investors that includes South African World Cup-winning former captain Francois Pienaar.

title: Farnborough Airport entrances blocked by protesters
description: Environmental activists are protesting against the emissions caused by private flights in Farnborough.

title: Rodrigo Duterte: Philippine president announces retirement from politics
description: The surprise announcement has fuelled speculation that his daughter will run for president next year.

title: Australia: Crocodile sinks his teeth into a flying drone
description: A ''croc'' leaps from the water to take down a drone in Darwin, Australia.

title: Soho hammer attack: Four people injured
description: A man attacked two people on Regent Street before entering a pub to assault two others.

title: Sandy Hook: Alex Jones loses case over 'hoax' remarks
description: The radio host must pay the families of victims after calling the Sandy Hook school shooting a "hoax".

title: Fuel supply still a big problem in SE England - retailers
description: But there has been a "distinct improvement" in other parts of the UK, retailers say.

title: Bryson DeChambeau beaten in longest drive final
description: Bryson DeChambeau bows out in the final after making the last eight of the Professional Longest Drive Association World Championship.

title: Taiwan says record 38 Chinese planes entered defence zone
description: It was China's biggest-ever incursion and nuclear-capable bombers took part, Taiwan says.

title: Man City: Khadija Shaw's journey from rebellious schoolgirl to goalscoring sensation
description: BBC Sport uncovers what makes one of women's football's most prolific goalscorers the player she is today.

title: The Papers: How police treat women, and Army on fuel patrol
description: How forces deal with violence against women is the lead story for several of Saturday's papers.

title: Kilogram of nails, screws and knives removed from man's stomach
description: The man had begun swallowing metal objects after quitting alcohol, doctors in Lithuania said.
